Job_Desc:
Are you passionate about finding insights from data and using them to drive client and business decisions? Do you have a strong background in mathematics, statistics, project controls, and programming? If so, Matrix New World is looking for a qualified and experienced Data Scientist and this may be the perfect fit for the next step in your career! We have offices in AZ, LA, NJ, NY and CT so the ideal candidate will determine where the position sits.
As a Data Scientist at Matrix, you will work with various teams across the organization to collect, analyze, and interpret large and complex data sets. You will use your skills in data mining, modeling, and data visualization to provide actionable recommendations and solutions for various business problems utilizing software tools including Power BI, Excel, and the other applications from the Microsoft Office suite. You will also communicate your findings and insights to both technical and non-technical audiences. You will join a growing team focused on exciting projects in the sustainability, engineering, geospatial, industrial, and environmental fields. This role is primarily focused on supporting client projects in both the public and private space.

Job_Desc:
ABOUT LENDISTRY
Lendistry is the country’s largest minority-led and technology-enabled small business and commercial real estate lender with Community Development Financial Institution (CDFI) and Community Development Entity (CDE) certification. We are a national employer whose mission is to provide economic opportunities and progressive growth for small business owners and their underserved communities as a source of financing and financial education.

POSITION OVERVIEW
The Data Scientist will help shape business strategy and product development decisions through data-driven insights. This is an exciting role for someone to make a direct impact on risk, product, and revenue strategy of Lendistry. Success in this role hinges on your technical aptitude, quantitative abilities, and business acumen: you know how to plow through data with SQL/Python/R/, surface insights using math/statistics/ML techniques, and measure the business impact using efficiency/conversion/profit metrics.

Job_Desc:
Description:

About the Company
Fast Growing Trees is one of the fastest-growing eCommerce companies in America. We enable people to live better, greener lives…one tree at a time. Founded in 2005, we have served over 1 million customers and continue to expand our market leadership and accelerate our growth within a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment. We’re looking for leaders who want to make a positive difference every day.
About the Role
As a Data Scientist you will be responsible for building and maintaining demand planning models, setting inventory levels, and optimizing nursery space usage to ensure we are in stock for our customers. You will work with Merchandising and Marketing to understand key demand drivers to create realistic forward demand projections. You will analyze trend data and build automated tools to drive replenishment for our highly seasonal ecommerce business. Finally you will work with transportation, suppliers, and the nursery staff to ensure a steady flow of inventory to meet demand within space constraints. If you are passionate about using data to solve complex problems within Supply Chain, this is the role for you!
Requirements:

Job_Desc:
ABOUT LENDISTRY
Lendistry is the country’s largest minority-led and technology-enabled small business and commercial real estate lender with Community Development Financial Institution (CDFI) and Community Development Entity (CDE) certification. We are a national employer whose mission is to provide economic opportunities and progressive growth for small business owners and their underserved communities as a source of financing and financial education.

POSITION OVERVIEW
The Data Scientist will help shape business strategy and product development decisions through data-driven insights. This is an exciting role for someone to make a direct impact on risk, product, and revenue strategy of Lendistry. Success in this role hinges on your technical aptitude, quantitative abilities, and business acumen: you know how to plow through data with SQL/Python/R/, surface insights using math/statistics/ML techniques, and measure the business impact using efficiency/conversion/profit metrics.

Job_Desc:
Description:

About the Company
Fast Growing Trees is one of the fastest-growing eCommerce companies in America. We enable people to live better, greener lives…one tree at a time. Founded in 2005, we have served over 1 million customers and continue to expand our market leadership and accelerate our growth within a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment. We’re looking for leaders who want to make a positive difference every day.
About the Role
As a Data Scientist you will be responsible for building and maintaining demand planning models, setting inventory levels, and optimizing nursery space usage to ensure we are in stock for our customers. You will work with Merchandising and Marketing to understand key demand drivers to create realistic forward demand projections. You will analyze trend data and build automated tools to drive replenishment for our highly seasonal ecommerce business. Finally you will work with transportation, suppliers, and the nursery staff to ensure a steady flow of inventory to meet demand within space constraints. If you are passionate about using data to solve complex problems within Supply Chain, this is the role for you!
Requirements:

Job_Desc:
Description:

About the Company
Fast Growing Trees is one of the fastest-growing eCommerce companies in America. We enable people to live better, greener lives…one tree at a time. Founded in 2005, we have served over 1 million customers and continue to expand our market leadership and accelerate our growth within a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment. We’re looking for leaders who want to make a positive difference every day.
About the Role
As a Data Scientist you will be responsible for building and maintaining demand planning models, setting inventory levels, and optimizing nursery space usage to ensure we are in stock for our customers. You will work with Merchandising and Marketing to understand key demand drivers to create realistic forward demand projections. You will analyze trend data and build automated tools to drive replenishment for our highly seasonal ecommerce business. Finally you will work with transportation, suppliers, and the nursery staff to ensure a steady flow of inventory to meet demand within space constraints. If you are passionate about using data to solve complex problems within Supply Chain, this is the role for you!
Requirements:

Lendistry is the country’s largest minority-led and technology-enabled small business and commercial real estate lender with Community Development Financial Institution (CDFI) and Community Development Entity (CDE) certification. We are a national employer whose mission is to provide economic opportunities and progressive growth for small business owners and their underserved communities as a source of financing and financial education.

POSITION OVERVIEW
The Data Scientist will help shape business strategy and product development decisions through data-driven insights. This is an exciting role for someone to make a direct impact on risk, product, and revenue strategy of Lendistry. Success in this role hinges on your technical aptitude, quantitative abilities, and business acumen: you know how to plow through data with SQL/Python/R/, surface insights using math/statistics/ML techniques, and measure the business impact using efficiency/conversion/profit metrics.

Job_Desc:
Description:

About the Company
Fast Growing Trees is one of the fastest-growing eCommerce companies in America. We enable people to live better, greener lives…one tree at a time. Founded in 2005, we have served over 1 million customers and continue to expand our market leadership and accelerate our growth within a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment. We’re looking for leaders who want to make a positive difference every day.
About the Role
As a Data Scientist you will be responsible for building and maintaining demand planning models, setting inventory levels, and optimizing nursery space usage to ensure we are in stock for our customers. You will work with Merchandising and Marketing to understand key demand drivers to create realistic forward demand projections. You will analyze trend data and build automated tools to drive replenishment for our highly seasonal ecommerce business. Finally you will work with transportation, suppliers, and the nursery staff to ensure a steady flow of inventory to meet demand within space constraints. If you are passionate about using data to solve complex problems within Supply Chain, this is the role for you!
Requirements:

Are you passionate about finding insights from data and using them to drive client and business decisions? Do you have a strong background in mathematics, statistics, project controls, and programming? If so, Matrix New World is looking for a qualified and experienced Data Scientist and this may be the perfect fit for the next step in your career! We have offices in AZ, LA, NJ, NY and CT so the ideal candidate will determine where the position sits.
As a Data Scientist at Matrix, you will work with various teams across the organization to collect, analyze, and interpret large and complex data sets. You will use your skills in data mining, modeling, and data visualization to provide actionable recommendations and solutions for various business problems utilizing software tools including Power BI, Excel, and the other applications from the Microsoft Office suite. You will also communicate your findings and insights to both technical and non-technical audiences. You will join a growing team focused on exciting projects in the sustainability, engineering, geospatial, industrial, and environmental fields. This role is primarily focused on supporting client projects in both the public and private space.

Job_Desc:
Description:

About the Company
Fast Growing Trees is one of the fastest-growing eCommerce companies in America. We enable people to live better, greener lives…one tree at a time. Founded in 2005, we have served over 1 million customers and continue to expand our market leadership and accelerate our growth within a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment. We’re looking for leaders who want to make a positive difference every day.
About the Role
As a Data Scientist you will be responsible for building and maintaining demand planning models, setting inventory levels, and optimizing nursery space usage to ensure we are in stock for our customers. You will work with Merchandising and Marketing to understand key demand drivers to create realistic forward demand projections. You will analyze trend data and build automated tools to drive replenishment for our highly seasonal ecommerce business. Finally you will work with transportation, suppliers, and the nursery staff to ensure a steady flow of inventory to meet demand within space constraints. If you are passionate about using data to solve complex problems within Supply Chain, this is the role for you!

Are you passionate about finding insights from data and using them to drive client and business decisions? As a Data Scientist at Matrix, you will work with various teams across the organization to collect, analyze, and interpret large and complex data sets. You will use your skills in data mining, modeling, and data visualization to provide actionable recommendations and solutions for various business problems utilizing software tools including Power BI, Excel, and the other applications from the Microsoft Office suite. This role is primarily focused on supporting client projects in both the public and private space.

The Data Scientist will help shape business strategy and product development decisions through data-driven insights. This is an exciting role for someone to make a direct impact on risk, product, and revenue strategy of Lendistry. Success in this role hinges on your technical aptitude, quantitative abilities, and business acumen: you know how to plow through data with SQL/Python/R/, surface insights using math/statistics/ML techniques, and measure the business impact using efficiency/conversion/profit metrics.

The Data Scientist will help shape business strategy and product development decisions through data-driven insights. Success in this role hinges on your technical aptitude, quantitative abilities, and business acumen: you know how to plow through data with SQL/Python/R/, surface insights using math/statistics/ML techniques, and measure the business impact using efficiency/conversion/profit metrics.

About the Company
Fast Growing Trees is one of the fastest-growing eCommerce companies in America. We enable people to live better, greener lives…one tree at a time. Founded in 2005, we have served over 1 million customers and continue to expand our market leadership and accelerate our growth within a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment. We’re looking for leaders who want to make a positive difference every day.
About the Role
As a Data Scientist you will be responsible for building and maintaining demand planning models, setting inventory levels, and optimizing nursery space usage to ensure we are in stock for our customers. You will work with Merchandising and Marketing to understand key demand drivers to create realistic forward demand projections. You will analyze trend data and build automated tools to drive replenishment for our highly seasonal ecommerce business. Finally you will work with transportation, suppliers, and the nursery staff to ensure a steady flow of inventory to meet demand within space constraints. If you are passionate about using data to solve complex problems within Supply Chain, this is the role for you!

The Data Scientist will help shape business strategy and product development decisions through data-driven insights. Success in this role hinges on your technical aptitude, quantitative abilities, and business acumen: you know how to plow through data with SQL/Python/R/, surface insights using math/statistics/ML techniques, and measure the business impact using efficiency/conversion/profit metrics.

About the Company
Fast Growing Trees is one of the fastest-growing eCommerce companies in America. We enable people to live better, greener lives…one tree at a time. Founded in 2005, we have served over 1 million customers and continue to expand our market leadership and accelerate our growth within a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment. We’re looking for leaders who want to make a positive difference every day.
About the Role
As a Data Scientist you will be responsible for building and maintaining demand planning models, setting inventory levels, and optimizing nursery space usage to ensure we are in stock for our customers. You will work with Merchandising and Marketing to understand key demand drivers to create realistic forward demand projections. You will analyze trend data and build automated tools to drive replenishment for our highly seasonal ecommerce business. Finally you will work with transportation, suppliers, and the nursery staff to ensure a steady flow of inventory to meet demand within space constraints. If you are passionate about using data to solve complex problems within Supply Chain, this is the role for you!

Job_Desc:
Description:

About the Company
Fast Growing Trees is one of the fastest-growing eCommerce companies in America. We enable people to live better, greener lives…one tree at a time. Founded in 2005, we have served over 1 million customers and continue to expand our market leadership and accelerate our growth within a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment. We’re looking for leaders who want to make a positive difference every day.
About the Role
As a Data Scientist you will be responsible for building and maintaining demand planning models, setting inventory levels, and optimizing nursery space usage to ensure we are in stock for our customers. You will work with Merchandising and Marketing to understand key demand drivers to create realistic forward demand projections. You will analyze trend data and build automated tools to drive replenishment for our highly seasonal ecommerce business. Finally you will work with transportation, suppliers, and the nursery staff to ensure a steady flow of inventory to meet demand within space constraints. If you are passionate about using data to solve complex problems within Supply Chain, this is the role for you!

Job_Desc:
Description:

About the Company
Fast Growing Trees is one of the fastest-growing eCommerce companies in America. We enable people to live better, greener lives…one tree at a time. Founded in 2005, we have served over 1 million customers and continue to expand our market leadership and accelerate our growth within a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment. We’re looking for leaders who want to make a positive difference every day.
About the Role
As a Data Scientist you will be responsible for building and maintaining demand planning models, setting inventory levels, and optimizing nursery space usage to ensure we are in stock for our customers. You will work with Merchandising and Marketing to understand key demand drivers to create realistic forward demand projections. You will analyze trend data and build automated tools to drive replenishment for our highly seasonal ecommerce business. Finally you will work with transportation, suppliers, and the nursery staff to ensure a steady flow of inventory to meet demand within space constraints. If you are passionate about using data to solve complex problems within Supply Chain, this is the role for you!
Requirements:

Are you passionate about finding insights from data and using them to drive client and business decisions? Do you have a strong background in mathematics, statistics, project controls, and programming? If so, Matrix New World is looking for a qualified and experienced Data Scientist and this may be the perfect fit for the next step in your career! We have offices in AZ, LA, NJ, NY and CT so the ideal candidate will determine where the position sits.
As a Data Scientist at Matrix, you will work with various teams across the organization to collect, analyze, and interpret large and complex data sets. You will use your skills in data mining, modeling, and data visualization to provide actionable recommendations and solutions for various business problems utilizing software tools including Power BI, Excel, and the other applications from the Microsoft Office suite. You will also communicate your findings and insights to both technical and non-technical audiences. You will join a growing team focused on exciting projects in the sustainability, engineering, geospatial, industrial, and environmental fields. This role is primarily focused on supporting client projects in both the public and private space.

Job_Desc:
Description:

About the Company
Fast Growing Trees is one of the fastest-growing eCommerce companies in America. We enable people to live better, greener lives…one tree at a time. Founded in 2005, we have served over 1 million customers and continue to expand our market leadership and accelerate our growth within a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment. We’re looking for leaders who want to make a positive difference every day.
About the Role
As a Data Scientist you will be responsible for building and maintaining demand planning models, setting inventory levels, and optimizing nursery space usage to ensure we are in stock for our customers. You will work with Merchandising and Marketing to understand key demand drivers to create realistic forward demand projections. You will analyze trend data and build automated tools to drive replenishment for our highly seasonal ecommerce business. Finally you will work with transportation, suppliers, and the nursery staff to ensure a steady flow of inventory to meet demand within space constraints. If you are passionate about using data to solve complex problems within Supply Chain, this is the role for you!

Are you passionate about finding insights from data and using them to drive client and business decisions? Do you have a strong background in mathematics, statistics, project controls, and programming? If so, Matrix New World is looking for a qualified and experienced Data Scientist and this may be the perfect fit for the next step in your career! We have offices in AZ, LA, NJ, NY and CT so the ideal candidate will determine where the position sits.
As a Data Scientist at Matrix, you will work with various teams across the organization to collect, analyze, and interpret large and complex data sets. You will use your skills in data mining, modeling, and data visualization to provide actionable recommendations and solutions for various business problems utilizing software tools including Power BI, Excel, and the other applications from the Microsoft Office suite. You will also communicate your findings and insights to both technical and non-technical audiences. You will join a growing team focused on exciting projects in the sustainability, engineering, geospatial, industrial, and environmental fields. This role is primarily focused on supporting client projects in both the public and private space.

Lendistry is the country’s largest minority-led and technology-enabled small business and commercial real estate lender with Community Development Financial Institution (CDFI) and Community Development Entity (CDE) certification. POSITION OVERVIEW
The Data Scientist will help shape business strategy and product development decisions through data-driven insights. This is an exciting role for someone to make a direct impact on risk, product, and revenue strategy of Lendistry. Success in this role hinges on your technical aptitude, quantitative abilities, and business acumen: you know how to plow through data with SQL/Python/R/, surface insights using math/statistics/ML techniques, and measure the business impact using efficiency/conversion/profit metrics.

Founded in 2005, we have served over 1 million customers and continue to expand our market leadership and accelerate our growth within a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment. We’re looking for leaders who want to make a positive difference every day.
About the Role
As a Data Scientist you will be responsible for building and maintaining demand planning models, setting inventory levels, and optimizing nursery space usage to ensure we are in stock for our customers. You will work with Merchandising and Marketing to understand key demand drivers to create realistic forward demand projections. You will analyze trend data and build automated tools to drive replenishment for our highly seasonal ecommerce business. Finally you will work with transportation, suppliers, and the nursery staff to ensure a steady flow of inventory to meet demand within space constraints. If you are passionate about using data to solve complex problems within Supply Chain, this is the role for you!

Are you passionate about finding insights from data and using them to drive client and business decisions? Do you have a strong background in mathematics, statistics, project controls, and programming? If so, Matrix New World is looking for a qualified and experienced Data Scientist and this may be the perfect fit for the next step in your career! We have offices in AZ, LA, NJ, NY and CT so the ideal candidate will determine where the position sits.
As a Data Scientist at Matrix, you will work with various teams across the organization to collect, analyze, and interpret large and complex data sets. You will use your skills in data mining, modeling, and data visualization to provide actionable recommendations and solutions for various business problems utilizing software tools including Power BI, Excel, and the other applications from the Microsoft Office suite. You will also communicate your findings and insights to both technical and non-technical audiences. You will join a growing team focused on exciting projects in the sustainability, engineering, geospatial, industrial, and environmental fields. This role is primarily focused on supporting client projects in both the public and private space.

The Data Scientist will help shape business strategy and product development decisions through data-driven insights. This is an exciting role for someone to make a direct impact on risk, product, and revenue strategy of Lendistry. Success in this role hinges on your technical aptitude, quantitative abilities, and business acumen: you know how to plow through data with SQL/Python/R/, surface insights using math/statistics/ML techniques, and measure the business impact using efficiency/conversion/profit metrics.

If so, Matrix New World is looking for a qualified and experienced Data Scientist and this may be the perfect fit for the next step in your career! We have offices in AZ, LA, NJ, NY and CT so the ideal candidate will determine where the position sits.
As a Data Scientist at Matrix, you will work with various teams across the organization to collect, analyze, and interpret large and complex data sets. You will use your skills in data mining, modeling, and data visualization to provide actionable recommendations and solutions for various business problems utilizing software tools including Power BI, Excel, and the other applications from the Microsoft Office suite. You will also communicate your findings and insights to both technical and non-technical audiences. You will join a growing team focused on exciting projects in the sustainability, engineering, geospatial, industrial, and environmental fields. This role is primarily focused on supporting client projects in both the public and private space.

About the Company

Founded in 2005, we have served over 1 million customers and continue to expand our market leadership and accelerate our growth within a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment. We’re looking for leaders who want to make a positive difference every day.
About the Role
As a Data Scientist you will be responsible for building and maintaining demand planning models, setting inventory levels, and optimizing nursery space usage to ensure we are in stock for our customers. You will work with Merchandising and Marketing to understand key demand drivers to create realistic forward demand projections. You will analyze trend data and build automated tools to drive replenishment for our highly seasonal ecommerce business. Finally you will work with transportation, suppliers, and the nursery staff to ensure a steady flow of inventory to meet demand within space constraints. If you are passionate about using data to solve complex problems within Supply Chain, this is the role for you!

The Sponsor requires support specializing in natural language processing (NLP) and associated data preparation to help identify challenges and opportunities for the Sponsor’s customers. The Sponsor needs experienced SQL and Python skills to transform the Sponsor’s structured and unstructured data into clear and supported analytic insights to help customers with decision making related to production, resources and personnel. The work may be performed independently or within a team environment.
WORK REQUIREMENTS
The Contractor shall work closely with the Sponsor’s data scientists and technical team to implement requirements; however, the Sponsor’s GTM will manage the priorities.

Job_Desc:
ABOUT LENDISTRY
Lendistry is the country’s largest minority-led and technology-enabled small business and commercial real estate lender with Community Development Financial Institution (CDFI) and Community Development Entity (CDE) certification. We are a national employer whose mission is to provide economic opportunities and progressive growth for small business owners and their underserved communities as a source of financing and financial education.

POSITION OVERVIEW
The Data Scientist will help shape business strategy and product development decisions through data-driven insights. This is an exciting role for someone to make a direct impact on risk, product, and revenue strategy of Lendistry. Success in this role hinges on your technical aptitude, quantitative abilities, and business acumen: you know how to plow through data with SQL/Python/R/, surface insights using math/statistics/ML techniques, and measure the business impact using efficiency/conversion/profit metrics.

Job_Desc:
Description:

About the Company
Fast Growing Trees is one of the fastest-growing eCommerce companies in America. We enable people to live better, greener lives…one tree at a time. Founded in 2005, we have served over 1 million customers and continue to expand our market leadership and accelerate our growth within a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment. We’re looking for leaders who want to make a positive difference every day.
About the Role
As a Data Scientist you will be responsible for building and maintaining demand planning models, setting inventory levels, and optimizing nursery space usage to ensure we are in stock for our customers. You will work with Merchandising and Marketing to understand key demand drivers to create realistic forward demand projections. You will analyze trend data and build automated tools to drive replenishment for our highly seasonal ecommerce business. Finally you will work with transportation, suppliers, and the nursery staff to ensure a steady flow of inventory to meet demand within space constraints. If you are passionate about using data to solve complex problems within Supply Chain, this is the role for you!
Requirements:

Job_Desc:
Description:

About the Company
Fast Growing Trees is one of the fastest-growing eCommerce companies in America. We enable people to live better, greener lives…one tree at a time. Founded in 2005, we have served over 1 million customers and continue to expand our market leadership and accelerate our growth within a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment. We’re looking for leaders who want to make a positive difference every day.
About the Role
As a Data Scientist you will be responsible for building and maintaining demand planning models, setting inventory levels, and optimizing nursery space usage to ensure we are in stock for our customers. You will work with Merchandising and Marketing to understand key demand drivers to create realistic forward demand projections. You will analyze trend data and build automated tools to drive replenishment for our highly seasonal ecommerce business. Finally you will work with transportation, suppliers, and the nursery staff to ensure a steady flow of inventory to meet demand within space constraints. If you are passionate about using data to solve complex problems within Supply Chain, this is the role for you!
Requirements:

Job_Desc:
Description:

About the Company
Fast Growing Trees is one of the fastest-growing eCommerce companies in America. We enable people to live better, greener lives…one tree at a time. Founded in 2005, we have served over 1 million customers and continue to expand our market leadership and accelerate our growth within a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment. We’re looking for leaders who want to make a positive difference every day.
About the Role
As a Data Scientist you will be responsible for building and maintaining demand planning models, setting inventory levels, and optimizing nursery space usage to ensure we are in stock for our customers. You will work with Merchandising and Marketing to understand key demand drivers to create realistic forward demand projections. You will analyze trend data and build automated tools to drive replenishment for our highly seasonal ecommerce business. Finally you will work with transportation, suppliers, and the nursery staff to ensure a steady flow of inventory to meet demand within space constraints. If you are passionate about using data to solve complex problems within Supply Chain, this is the role for you!
Requirements:

As a Data Scientist at Matrix, you will work with various teams across the organization to collect, analyze, and interpret large and complex data sets. This role is primarily focused on supporting client projects in both the public and private space.

The Data Scientist will help shape business strategy and product development decisions through data-driven insights. This is an exciting role for someone to make a direct impact on risk, product, and revenue strategy of Lendistry. Success in this role hinges on your technical aptitude, quantitative abilities, and business acumen: you know how to plow through data with SQL/Python/R/, surface insights using math/statistics/ML techniques, and measure the business impact using efficiency/conversion/profit metrics.

Description:

About the Company
Fast Growing Trees is one of the fastest-growing eCommerce companies in America. We enable people to live better, greener lives…one tree at a time. Founded in 2005, we have served over 1 million customers and continue to expand our market leadership and accelerate our growth within a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment. We’re looking for leaders who want to make a positive difference every day.
About the Role
As a Data Scientist you will be responsible for building and maintaining demand planning models, setting inventory levels, and optimizing nursery space usage to ensure we are in stock for our customers. You will work with Merchandising and Marketing to understand key demand drivers to create realistic forward demand projections. You will analyze trend data and build automated tools to drive replenishment for our highly seasonal ecommerce business. Finally you will work with transportation, suppliers, and the nursery staff to ensure a steady flow of inventory to meet demand within space constraints. If you are passionate about using data to solve complex problems within Supply Chain, this is the role for you!

Are you passionate about finding insights from data and using them to drive client and business decisions? As a Data Scientist at Matrix, you will work with various teams across the organization to collect, analyze, and interpret large and complex data sets. You will use your skills in data mining, modeling, and data visualization to provide actionable recommendations and solutions for various business problems utilizing software tools including Power BI, Excel, and the other applications from the Microsoft Office suite. You will also communicate your findings and insights to both technical and non-technical audiences. You will join a growing team focused on exciting projects in the sustainability, engineering, geospatial, industrial, and environmental fields. This role is primarily focused on supporting client projects in both the public and private space.

Lendistry is the country’s largest minority-led and technology-enabled small business and commercial real estate lender with Community Development Financial Institution (CDFI) and Community Development Entity (CDE) certification. We are a national employer whose mission is to provide economic opportunities and progressive growth for small business owners and their underserved communities as a source of financing and financial education.

POSITION OVERVIEW
The Data Scientist will help shape business strategy and product development decisions through data-driven insights. This is an exciting role for someone to make a direct impact on risk, product, and revenue strategy of Lendistry. Success in this role hinges on your technical aptitude, quantitative abilities, and business acumen: you know how to plow through data with SQL/Python/R/, surface insights using math/statistics/ML techniques, and measure the business impact using efficiency/conversion/profit metrics.

Job_Desc:
Description:

About the Company
Fast Growing Trees is one of the fastest-growing eCommerce companies in America. We enable people to live better, greener lives…one tree at a time. Founded in 2005, we have served over 1 million customers and continue to expand our market leadership and accelerate our growth within a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment. We’re looking for leaders who want to make a positive difference every day.
About the Role
As a Data Scientist you will be responsible for building and maintaining demand planning models, setting inventory levels, and optimizing nursery space usage to ensure we are in stock for our customers. You will work with Merchandising and Marketing to understand key demand drivers to create realistic forward demand projections. You will analyze trend data and build automated tools to drive replenishment for our highly seasonal ecommerce business. Finally you will work with transportation, suppliers, and the nursery staff to ensure a steady flow of inventory to meet demand within space constraints. If you are passionate about using data to solve complex problems within Supply Chain, this is the role for you!
Requirements:

Job_Desc:
ABOUT LENDISTRY
Lendistry is the country’s largest minority-led and technology-enabled small business and commercial real estate lender with Community Development Financial Institution (CDFI) and Community Development Entity (CDE) certification. We are a national employer whose mission is to provide economic opportunities and progressive growth for small business owners and their underserved communities as a source of financing and financial education.

POSITION OVERVIEW
The Data Scientist will help shape business strategy and product development decisions through data-driven insights. This is an exciting role for someone to make a direct impact on risk, product, and revenue strategy of Lendistry. Success in this role hinges on your technical aptitude, quantitative abilities, and business acumen: you know how to plow through data with SQL/Python/R/, surface insights using math/statistics/ML techniques, and measure the business impact using efficiency/conversion/profit metrics.

Job_Desc:
Description:

About the Company
Fast Growing Trees is one of the fastest-growing eCommerce companies in America. We enable people to live better, greener lives…one tree at a time. Founded in 2005, we have served over 1 million customers and continue to expand our market leadership and accelerate our growth within a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment. We’re looking for leaders who want to make a positive difference every day.
About the Role
As a Data Scientist you will be responsible for building and maintaining demand planning models, setting inventory levels, and optimizing nursery space usage to ensure we are in stock for our customers. You will work with Merchandising and Marketing to understand key demand drivers to create realistic forward demand projections. You will analyze trend data and build automated tools to drive replenishment for our highly seasonal ecommerce business. Finally you will work with transportation, suppliers, and the nursery staff to ensure a steady flow of inventory to meet demand within space constraints. If you are passionate about using data to solve complex problems within Supply Chain, this is the role for you!

Job_Desc:
Description:

About the Company
Fast Growing Trees is one of the fastest-growing eCommerce companies in America. We enable people to live better, greener lives…one tree at a time. Founded in 2005, we have served over 1 million customers and continue to expand our market leadership and accelerate our growth within a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment. We’re looking for leaders who want to make a positive difference every day.
About the Role
As a Data Scientist you will be responsible for building and maintaining demand planning models, setting inventory levels, and optimizing nursery space usage to ensure we are in stock for our customers. You will work with Merchandising and Marketing to understand key demand drivers to create realistic forward demand projections. You will analyze trend data and build automated tools to drive replenishment for our highly seasonal ecommerce business. Finally you will work with transportation, suppliers, and the nursery staff to ensure a steady flow of inventory to meet demand within space constraints. If you are passionate about using data to solve complex problems within Supply Chain, this is the role for you!
Requirements:

About the Company
Fast Growing Trees is one of the fastest-growing eCommerce companies in America. We enable people to live better, greener lives…one tree at a time. Founded in 2005, we have served over 1 million customers and continue to expand our market leadership and accelerate our growth within a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment. We’re looking for leaders who want to make a positive difference every day.
About the Role
As a Data Scientist you will be responsible for building and maintaining demand planning models, setting inventory levels, and optimizing nursery space usage to ensure we are in stock for our customers. You will work with Merchandising and Marketing to understand key demand drivers to create realistic forward demand projections. You will analyze trend data and build automated tools to drive replenishment for our highly seasonal ecommerce business. Finally you will work with transportation, suppliers, and the nursery staff to ensure a steady flow of inventory to meet demand within space constraints. If you are passionate about using data to solve complex problems within Supply Chain, this is the role for you!

Job_Desc:
Description:

About the Company
Fast Growing Trees is one of the fastest-growing eCommerce companies in America. We enable people to live better, greener lives…one tree at a time. Founded in 2005, we have served over 1 million customers and continue to expand our market leadership and accelerate our growth within a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment. We’re looking for leaders who want to make a positive difference every day.
About the Role
As a Data Scientist you will be responsible for building and maintaining demand planning models, setting inventory levels, and optimizing nursery space usage to ensure we are in stock for our customers. You will work with Merchandising and Marketing to understand key demand drivers to create realistic forward demand projections. You will analyze trend data and build automated tools to drive replenishment for our highly seasonal ecommerce business. Finally you will work with transportation, suppliers, and the nursery staff to ensure a steady flow of inventory to meet demand within space constraints. If you are passionate about using data to solve complex problems within Supply Chain, this is the role for you!

Are you passionate about finding insights from data and using them to drive client and business decisions? Do you have a strong background in mathematics, statistics, project controls, and programming? If so, Matrix New World is looking for a qualified and experienced Data Scientist and this may be the perfect fit for the next step in your career! We have offices in AZ, LA, NJ, NY and CT so the ideal candidate will determine where the position sits.
As a Data Scientist at Matrix, you will work with various teams across the organization to collect, analyze, and interpret large and complex data sets. You will use your skills in data mining, modeling, and data visualization to provide actionable recommendations and solutions for various business problems utilizing software tools including Power BI, Excel, and the other applications from the Microsoft Office suite. You will also communicate your findings and insights to both technical and non-technical audiences. You will join a growing team focused on exciting projects in the sustainability, engineering, geospatial, industrial, and environmental fields. This role is primarily focused on supporting client projects in both the public and private space.

The Data Scientist will help shape business strategy and product development decisions through data-driven insights. This is an exciting role for someone to make a direct impact on risk, product, and revenue strategy of Lendistry. Success in this role hinges on your technical aptitude, quantitative abilities, and business acumen: you know how to plow through data with SQL/Python/R/, surface insights using math/statistics/ML techniques, and measure the business impact using efficiency/conversion/profit metrics.

ABOUT LENDISTRY
Lendistry is the country’s largest minority-led and technology-enabled small business and commercial real estate lender with Community Development Financial Institution (CDFI) and Community Development Entity (CDE) certification. We are a national employer whose mission is to provide economic opportunities and progressive growth for small business owners and their underserved communities as a source of financing and financial education.

POSITION OVERVIEW
The Data Scientist will help shape business strategy and product development decisions through data-driven insights. This is an exciting role for someone to make a direct impact on risk, product, and revenue strategy of Lendistry. Success in this role hinges on your technical aptitude, quantitative abilities, and business acumen: you know how to plow through data with SQL/Python/R/, surface insights using math/statistics/ML techniques, and measure the business impact using efficiency/conversion/profit metrics.

Job_Desc:
Description:

About the Company
Fast Growing Trees is one of the fastest-growing eCommerce companies in America. We enable people to live better, greener lives…one tree at a time. Founded in 2005, we have served over 1 million customers and continue to expand our market leadership and accelerate our growth within a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment. We’re looking for leaders who want to make a positive difference every day.
About the Role
As a Data Scientist you will be responsible for building and maintaining demand planning models, setting inventory levels, and optimizing nursery space usage to ensure we are in stock for our customers. You will work with Merchandising and Marketing to understand key demand drivers to create realistic forward demand projections. You will analyze trend data and build automated tools to drive replenishment for our highly seasonal ecommerce business. Finally you will work with transportation, suppliers, and the nursery staff to ensure a steady flow of inventory to meet demand within space constraints. If you are passionate about using data to solve complex problems within Supply Chain, this is the role for you!
Requirements:

Lendistry is the country’s largest minority-led and technology-enabled small business and commercial real estate lender with Community Development Financial Institution (CDFI) and Community Development Entity (CDE) certification. POSITION OVERVIEW
The Data Scientist will help shape business strategy and product development decisions through data-driven insights. This is an exciting role for someone to make a direct impact on risk, product, and revenue strategy of Lendistry. Success in this role hinges on your technical aptitude, quantitative abilities, and business acumen: you know how to plow through data with SQL/Python/R/, surface insights using math/statistics/ML techniques, and measure the business impact using efficiency/conversion/profit metrics.

About the Company
Fast Growing Trees is one of the fastest-growing eCommerce companies in America. We enable people to live better, greener lives…one tree at a time. Founded in 2005, we have served over 1 million customers and continue to expand our market leadership and accelerate our growth within a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment. We’re looking for leaders who want to make a positive difference every day.
About the Role
As a Data Scientist you will be responsible for building and maintaining demand planning models, setting inventory levels, and optimizing nursery space usage to ensure we are in stock for our customers. You will work with Merchandising and Marketing to understand key demand drivers to create realistic forward demand projections. You will analyze trend data and build automated tools to drive replenishment for our highly seasonal ecommerce business. Finally you will work with transportation, suppliers, and the nursery staff to ensure a steady flow of inventory to meet demand within space constraints. If you are passionate about using data to solve complex problems within Supply Chain, this is the role for you!

Job_Desc:

About the Company
Fast Growing Trees is one of the fastest-growing eCommerce companies in America. We enable people to live better, greener lives…one tree at a time. Founded in 2005, we have served over 1 million customers and continue to expand our market leadership and accelerate our growth within a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment. We’re looking for leaders who want to make a positive difference every day.
About the Role
As a Data Scientist you will be responsible for building and maintaining demand planning models, setting inventory levels, and optimizing nursery space usage to ensure we are in stock for our customers. You will work with Merchandising and Marketing to understand key demand drivers to create realistic forward demand projections. You will analyze trend data and build automated tools to drive replenishment for our highly seasonal ecommerce business. Finally you will work with transportation, suppliers, and the nursery staff to ensure a steady flow of inventory to meet demand within space constraints. If you are passionate about using data to solve complex problems within Supply Chain, this is the role for you!

Lendistry is the country’s largest minority-led and technology-enabled small business and commercial real estate lender with Community Development Financial Institution (CDFI) and Community Development Entity (CDE) certification. We are a national employer whose mission is to provide economic opportunities and progressive growth for small business owners and their underserved communities as a source of financing and financial education.

POSITION OVERVIEW
The Data Scientist will help shape business strategy and product development decisions through data-driven insights. This is an exciting role for someone to make a direct impact on risk, product, and revenue strategy of Lendistry. Success in this role hinges on your technical aptitude, quantitative abilities, and business acumen: you know how to plow through data with SQL/Python/R/, surface insights using math/statistics/ML techniques, and measure the business impact using efficiency/conversion/profit metrics.

Job_Desc:
Description:

About the Company
Fast Growing Trees is one of the fastest-growing eCommerce companies in America. We enable people to live better, greener lives…one tree at a time. Founded in 2005, we have served over 1 million customers and continue to expand our market leadership and accelerate our growth within a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment. We’re looking for leaders who want to make a positive difference every day.
About the Role
As a Data Scientist you will be responsible for building and maintaining demand planning models, setting inventory levels, and optimizing nursery space usage to ensure we are in stock for our customers. You will work with Merchandising and Marketing to understand key demand drivers to create realistic forward demand projections. You will analyze trend data and build automated tools to drive replenishment for our highly seasonal ecommerce business. Finally you will work with transportation, suppliers, and the nursery staff to ensure a steady flow of inventory to meet demand within space constraints. If you are passionate about using data to solve complex problems within Supply Chain, this is the role for you!
Requirements:

Job_Desc:
Are you passionate about finding insights from data and using them to drive client and business decisions? Do you have a strong background in mathematics, statistics, project controls, and programming? If so, Matrix New World is looking for a qualified and experienced Data Scientist and this may be the perfect fit for the next step in your career! We have offices in AZ, LA, NJ, NY and CT so the ideal candidate will determine where the position sits.
As a Data Scientist at Matrix, you will work with various teams across the organization to collect, analyze, and interpret large and complex data sets. You will use your skills in data mining, modeling, and data visualization to provide actionable recommendations and solutions for various business problems utilizing software tools including Power BI, Excel, and the other applications from the Microsoft Office suite. You will also communicate your findings and insights to both technical and non-technical audiences. You will join a growing team focused on exciting projects in the sustainability, engineering, geospatial, industrial, and environmental fields. This role is primarily focused on supporting client projects in both the public and private space.

Tidepool is a leading healthcare technology nonprofit company that is revolutionizing the way people with diabetes manage their condition. Our mission is to make diabetes data more accessible, actionable, and meaningful, empowering individuals and healthcare providers to make informed decisions and improve health outcomes. By leveraging cutting-edge technology and data-driven solutions, Tidepool is dedicated to making a positive impact on the lives of millions affected by diabetes.

Job_Desc:
Description:

About the Company
Fast Growing Trees is one of the fastest-growing eCommerce companies in America. We enable people to live better, greener lives…one tree at a time. Founded in 2005, we have served over 1 million customers and continue to expand our market leadership and accelerate our growth within a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment. We’re looking for leaders who want to make a positive difference every day.
About the Role
As a Data Scientist you will be responsible for building and maintaining demand planning models, setting inventory levels, and optimizing nursery space usage to ensure we are in stock for our customers. You will work with Merchandising and Marketing to understand key demand drivers to create realistic forward demand projections. You will analyze trend data and build automated tools to drive replenishment for our highly seasonal ecommerce business. Finally you will work with transportation, suppliers, and the nursery staff to ensure a steady flow of inventory to meet demand within space constraints. If you are passionate about using data to solve complex problems within Supply Chain, this is the role for you!
